Notes: 20 March 2020    Schools will close from Monday 23 March, except for children of key workers and vulnerable children. I’ve coded this as Friday as it was on this day that schools were closed and told they wouldn’t reopen after the weekend.    Universities all moved to online teaching and ended in person teaching by March 23rd, so physically closed.    Government source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713095253/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/schools-colleges-and-early-years-settings-to-close    BBC news source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713095034/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-51952314

Boris Johnson said the government intended to reopen then for early years pupils, Reception, Year 1 and Year 6.       Government source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713101829/https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/preparing-for-the-wider-opening-of-schools-from-1-june    BBC News Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713101448/https://www.bbc.com/news/education-52792769

On June 15, up to a quarter of Year 10 and Year 12 will be allowed "some contact" to help prepare for exams.  Universities remain closed for in person teaching.    Government source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713101829/https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/preparing-for-the-wider-opening-of-schools-from-1-june    BBC News Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713101448/https://www.bbc.com/news/education-52792769

2 July     Schools closed at all levels during regional lockdown in Leicester after a spike in cases.    Schools closed for all levels from Thursday 2 July and told not to reopen until next term (September). Coded this as a 3 until the end of the school term which in Leicester is 14th July. 2G coding will therefore resume on this date to best represent the national situation.    National Government source 29th June: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713102328/https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/local-action-to-tackle-coronavirus    Leicester City Council source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713102809/https://www.leicester.gov.uk/your-council/coronavirus/coronavirus-in-leicester-latest-news/    Leicestershire County Council term dates: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713102949/https://www.leicestershire.gov.uk/popular-now/school-term-dates    BBC News Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713102154/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-leicestershire-53233692

Schools closed at all levels during regional lockdown in Leicester after a spike in cases.    Schools closed for all levels from Thursday 2 July and told not to reopen until next term (September). Coded this as a 3 until the end of the school term which in Leicester is 14th July. 2G coding will therefore resume on this date to best represent the national situation.    National Government source 29th June: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713102328/https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/local-action-to-tackle-coronavirus    Leicester City Council source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713102809/https://www.leicester.gov.uk/your-council/coronavirus/coronavirus-in-leicester-latest-news/    Leicestershire County Council term dates: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713102949/https://www.leicestershire.gov.uk/popular-now/school-term-dates    BBC News Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713102154/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-leicestershire-53233692

"Schools and colleges across England will start to welcome back pupils with protective measures in place to help keep young people and staff safe."    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200914094957/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/pupils-start-returning-to-schools-in-england

National lockdown comes into effect in England on 5 November. However, all levels of education are to remain open under the same covid-safe protcols as the government says they will:    "Ensure schools, colleges and universities can stay open"    https://web.archive.org/web/20201104133027/https://www.gov.uk/guidance/new-national-restrictions-from-5-november

On 30th November a school near Taunton is closed due to COVID-19 pupil cases and as staff await test results.      https://web.archive.org/web/20201130195148/https://www.somersetcountygazette.co.uk/news/18907964.school-near-taunton-closed-covid-19-pupil-cases-staff-await-test-results/

Some secondary schools in England are closed due to COVID-19 outbreaks. As this is a very small number and proportion of the UK population and we're aiming to capture a significant geographical region with the T flag, I have coded this as a 0 and recorded it as a note.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201216100626/https://www.standard.co.uk/news/uk/eton-college-closes-coronavirus-outbreak-b255849.html

England enters lockdown on Tuesday 5 January. All schools are closed, except for the children of essential workers, despite all students having attended school on Monday 4th.     Colleges, primary (reception onwards) and secondary schools will remain open for vulnerable children and the children of critical workers. All other children will learn remotely until February half term    Universities- Those students who are undertaking training and study for the specific courses should return to face to face learning as planned and be tested twice, upon arrival or self-isolate for ten days, best fit for universities is a 3 code due to widespread closure.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210106100514/https://www.gov.uk/guidance/national-lockdown-stay-at-home

All levels of education reopen 8 March, with requirements for testing of teachers and pupils in schools. Colleges and further education providers/ universities can also open from this date.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210227120353/https://feweek.co.uk/2021/02/22/colleges-and-fe-providers-to-reopen-in-full-from-8-march-pm-announces/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210312150101/https://news.sky.com/story/covid-19-all-schools-in-england-to-reopen-on-8-march-as-pm-plots-course-to-ease-lockdown-12225278

17 May  All higher education students are able to access in-person teaching with recommended regular LFT testing and other restrictions  https://web.archive.org/web/20210521101701/https://www.gov.uk/guidance/covid-19-coronavirus-restrictions-what-you-can-and-cannot-do#may-whats-changed

4 January , this guidance applies to ENGLAND    No restrictions in place beyond face coverings which are not captured in 1 level so recording 0    Face coverings are recommended in schools with pupils in year 7 and above. They should be worn in most classrooms, and by pupils, students, staff and adult visitors when moving around buildings.    http://web.archive.org/web/20220110165630/https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

From Thursday, secondary school pupils will no longer have to wear face masks in classrooms and government guidance on their use in communal areas would be removed "shortly". Coding remains at a 1G due to the guidance on face mask use in communal areas    http://web.archive.org/web/20220121121233/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-60047438

24 February 2022    Staff and students without symptoms in England are no longer asked to test for Covid twice-weekly. Secondary school pupils also don't need to wear masks.    The legal requirement to self-isolate after a positive test is also being removed, although it is still recommended.    http://web.archive.org/web/20220225131929/https://www.bbc.com/news/education-51643556
